author: Michel_W
title: An exemplar MMMB
review:
Building Experience

Smooth, unproblematic, but nothing special. A brick separator will be handy when disassembling the model due to some stacked plates and tiles.

Parts

There are 60 parts, plus 6 spare, with a good variety of colours and designs: hinge and jumper plates, sloped and SNOT parts, cross plates, not to mention the spider.

Playability

I don't play with models so can't really judge this, but it feels more of a display than a play model. There is some poseability: the legs can be moved horizontally, the arms vertically, and the spider and the eyes can be rotated, but the tongue is fixed.

Value for money 

A free set is by definition excellent value for money. As I write this, the average price on Bricklink for the past 6 months has been £4.43, which is slightly less good value than a small boxed 3-in-1 creator set.

Overall

The blue parts jar a bit with the green ones for my taste, but fortunately most blue parts are in the back, thus not visible in the photo. Like most MMMBs, the back is quite 'blocky' and uninteresting. To sum up, it's a model to be seen from the front.

Other than those two minor quibbles, I feel this is what MMMBs should be: a quirky, fun, easy to build, poseable display model with a good variety of parts.
